Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (M.S.M.E.) program provides students with an opportunity to pursue advanced studies in a variety of specialty areas within mechanical engineering. The graduate program provides a balance between advanced theory and practical knowledge in the areas of computational mechanics and materials, dynamics and controls, manufacturing and metrology, motorsports engineering, thermal fluids science, and bioengineering. Both thesis and non-thesis options are available in the M.S.M.E. degree program. Graduate certificates are also offered in several specialty areas. For more details on the program, please visit the Department of Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science website.

ProgramName: Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science - Manufacturing and Metrology
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT (83), IELTS (6.5), or Duolingo (115).
Requirements:
Applicants must meet the general requirements for admission to a graduate degree program as specified by the Graduate School. Admission to the M.S.M.E. program is competitive. Meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission. The Department’s Graduate Admissions Committee considers all aspects of an application in its totality to make an admission decision. Minimum requirements for admission to the M.S.M.E. program include:

An earned baccalaureate degree in Mechanical Engineering, or in a related field such as another engineering discipline, physics, or mathematics, from an accredited college or university.
An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or better (on a 4.0 scale). Applicants with a lower GPA may be considered for provisional admission based on other factors.
The GRE is waived for applicants with a baccalaureate degree from an ABET-accredited program in the U.S. with a GPA of 3.0 or greater. The GRE is also waived for applicants with a Master’s or Doctoral degree from a U.S. institution.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (M.S.M.E.) degree program is designed to provide students with an opportunity to pursue a graduate-level education which will equip them with a unique set of advanced skills that are vital to research, high-tech industry, and other professional careers. Our program’s comprehensive curriculum blends instruction with hands-on labs and state-of-the-art computational facilities. The M.S.M.E. program offers a choice of two graduation paths. A Thesis option, recommended for research-oriented students who may wish to continue towards a Ph.D. degree. The Non-Thesis option is recommended for students who wish to focus on a particular application area or who have full-time jobs. In addition to a general M.S.M.E. degree, students can choose to concentrate in one of several high demand specialization areas, such as motorsports engineering, precision engineering, energy engineering, computational mechanics, manufacturing, or biomedical engineering.

ProgramName: Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science - Motorsports Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the official language are required to submit official scores for an English language proficiency test. Scores must be less than two years old. TOEFL: 557 (paper-based) or 83 (Internet-based). IELTS: 6.5. Duolingo English Test: 115. Pearson Test of English (PTE): 59.
Requirements: An undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field is required with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. For applicants with a degree in another field, completion of a set of prerequisite courses may be required before admission. Prospective students who do not have an undergraduate GPA of 3.0 may be considered for provisional admission if they have at least three years of professional experience in an engineering field or have an exceptional GRE score (V>150, Q>155, A>3.0). The GRE is not required for applicants with a bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering from an ABET-accredited program in the U.S. with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. The GRE is also not required for graduates with an engineering degree from UNC Charlotte. The GRE is required for all other applicants and may not be waived.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (M.S.M.E.) degree program at UNC Charlotte builds on the skills of undergraduate engineering, science and technology education with an advanced engineering curriculum. The program provides the education necessary to practice as a professional mechanical engineer in a variety of industries. The program offers thesis and non-thesis options. The M.S.M.E. degree program offers three concentrations: a general Mechanical Engineering concentration that can be customized to the student’s interests, a concentration in Motorsports Engineering, and a concentration in Metrology. The department also offers graduate certificates in Motorsports Engineering and other specialty areas, which can be completed as a stand-alone program or in conjunction with the M.S.M.E. program. The Motorsports Engineering concentration is ideal for students who wish to pursue a career in the motorsports industry. The curriculum focuses on the design, analysis, and optimization of racecars and racecar components.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $18,000 for master's students (e.g., Dean's Distinguished Graduate Fellowship)

ProgramName: Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science - Thermal Sciences and Fluid Mechanics
EnglishScore: For international students, an official TOEFL or IELTS score is required. A minimum total score of 83 on the iBT (with minimum scores of 20 on speaking, 20 on writing, 20 on reading, and 21 on listening) or a 6.5 overall on the IELTS is required.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (M.S.M.E.) program is a key part of graduate studies in the William States Lee College of Engineering, with over 100 students currently enrolled. A number of options are available to the students seeking a master's degree in mechanical engineering and engineering science. A thesis option and a non-thesis option are available. The M.S.M.E. degree requires 30 credit-hours of graduate work. The Mechanical Engineering program also offers an early-entry program for our undergraduate students. A wide variety of fellowships and assistantships is available to qualified students. Our faculty are active in a number of research areas and students often perform research on topics related to energy, manufacturing, metrology, mechanics, materials, and motorsports.
CostPerCredit: NC Resident: $243.06/credit hour (tuition only); Non-NC Resident: $1,034.83/credit hour (tuition only)

ProgramName: PhD in Mechanical Engineering and Engineering Science
EnglishScore: TOEFL/IELTS scores are required for international applicants unless they have earned a degree from a U.S. institution. The minimum score requirements are set by the Graduate School. The University accepts a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 83, a minimum IELTS score of 6.5, a minimum Duolingo score of 115, a minimum PTE score of 59, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: A bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or a closely-related discipline from a regionally accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale is recommended. Students with a GPA between 3.0 and 3.5 will be considered. For applicants with a master’s degree, a GPA of 3.5 or higher is recommended. All applicants must submit GRE scores. International applicants must also submit an English proficiency exam score (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo). A Statement of Purpose, a Resume/CV, and three letters of recommendation are also required for the application.
Department: The William States Lee College of Engineering
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy degree in Mechanical Engineering provides students an opportunity to contribute to the body of knowledge in their chosen area of research. Students develop an individualized plan of study to acquire specific knowledge needed for their research. All Ph.D. students work closely with a faculty advisor throughout their program, culminating in the completion and defense of a doctoral dissertation. The Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering is a broad-based degree without formal concentrations. However, students will develop a specialty in one of the research areas of the Department.
